HDG.ID.content: sameness of Being & thinking as the belonging together of the two [?] > [method, slow down] that was rash, perhaps of necessity, must repair that rashness

HDG.ID.linkedContent: sameness of Being & thinking as the belonging together of the two [?] > [method, slow down] that was rash, perhaps of necessity, must repair that rashness

HDG.BC.content: capture “universal representation” in a word’s sound (“being”) [?] > uselessness of discussion of word “is,” something superfluous (Überflussiges), perhaps even an excess (Überfluss)

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.BC.linkedContent: capture “universal representation” in a word’s sound (“being”) [?] > uselessness of discussion of word “is,” something superfluous (Überflussiges), perhaps even an excess (Überfluss)

HDG.BC.content: in thinking, we move in ontological difference > [***] perhaps too much, inappropriate to speak of the differentiation btwn Being/beings in 1st place, difference already objectified w/out being able to specify where it belongs [why is belonging what makes it inappropriate?] > talk of the differentiation: differentiation is origin of all differences [differance, but it would erase origin]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: in thinking, we move in ontological difference > [***] perhaps too much, inappropriate to speak of the differentiation btwn Being/beings in 1st place, difference already objectified w/out being able to specify where it belongs [why is belonging what makes it inappropriate?] > talk of the differentiation: differentiation is origin of all differences [differance, but it would erase origin]

HDG.BC.content: Nothing “is” turns Nothing into a being? > Nothing doesn’t need beings but it needs Being > perhaps Nothing is the same as Being, it is unique & incomparable: its essence as incontrovertibly incomparable belongs to Being, confirms Being’s uniqueness
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Nothing “is” turns Nothing into a being? > Nothing doesn’t need beings but it needs Being > perhaps Nothing is the same as Being, it is unique & incomparable: its essence as incontrovertibly incomparable belongs to Being, confirms Being’s uniqueness

HDG.BC.content: everything that comes into relation w/ human given a “subjective” tint > perhaps only “most modern” man is a “subject” [on whether we must subjectivize Being—very subtle way of not answering this question?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: everything that comes into relation w/ human given a “subjective” tint > perhaps only “most modern” man is a “subject” [on whether we must subjectivize Being—very subtle way of not answering this question?]

HDG.BC.content: inception has been, but not something past [inheritance], still presences, but concealed in its incipience [trace], perhaps inception of Being closer to us than everything we know, imperishable (Unvergängliche) [indestructible] > remembrance of inception not concerned w/ beings [how so???], but w/ what has been, i.e. what still presences
HDG.BC.linkedContent: inception has been, but not something past [inheritance], still presences, but concealed in its incipience [trace], perhaps inception of Being closer to us than everything we know, imperishable (Unvergängliche) [indestructible] > remembrance of inception not concerned w/ beings [how so???], but w/ what has been, i.e. what still presences

HDG.IWM.content: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]

HDG.QB.content: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it

HDG.QB.linkedContent: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it

HDG.MA.content: can a new ground/foundation be granted gain to man? new authochthony? > perhaps answer is near, near is always longest/hardest for humans > meditative thinking demands we not cling one-sidedly to a single idea: engage ourselves w/ what, at 1st sight, doesn’t go together at all [not a monomaniacal thought]

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.MA.linkedContent: can a new ground/foundation be granted gain to man? new authochthony? > perhaps answer is near, near is always longest/hardest for humans > meditative thinking demands we not cling one-sidedly to a single idea: engage ourselves w/ what, at 1st sight, doesn’t go together at all [not a monomaniacal thought]

HDG.CCP.content: don’t awaken Gelassenheit in ourselves on our own > is letting-be a kind of passivity? perhaps a higher acting concealed in Gelassenheit? Gelassenheit beyond distinction activity/passivity > transition from willing into Gelassenheit seems difficult

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.CCP.linkedContent: don’t awaken Gelassenheit in ourselves on our own > is letting-be a kind of passivity? perhaps a higher acting concealed in Gelassenheit? Gelassenheit beyond distinction activity/passivity > transition from willing into Gelassenheit seems difficult

HDG.CCP.content: nature of thinking perhaps fixed in Gelassenheit, if we don’t conceive of it as re-presenting [effort & attention risks representing nature of thinking] > what am I to do? nothing but wait > what are we to wait for? no one knows—but don’t give up your path
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: nature of thinking perhaps fixed in Gelassenheit, if we don’t conceive of it as re-presenting [effort & attention risks representing nature of thinking] > what am I to do? nothing but wait > what are we to wait for? no one knows—but don’t give up your path

HDG.CCP.content: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]

HDG.CCP.content: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.CCP.linkedContent: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

HDG.CCP.content: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]

HDG.DL.content: each man, each instant, in dialogue w/ forbears, perhaps even more, and more hidden, w/ those who will come after (Nachkommen) [inheritance, promise, future full of ghosts]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: each man, each instant, in dialogue w/ forbears, perhaps even more, and more hidden, w/ those who will come after (Nachkommen) [inheritance, promise, future full of ghosts]

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger comments on risk of calling Sprachwesen Saying, might we be elevating language to a fantastical, self-sustained being (Wesen) that can’t be encountered > but language is bound up w/ human speaking, needs human speaking > perhaps we miss the very nature of language when we ask after grounds > or is Sage: the abode of rest (Be-Ruhende), grants the quiet of mutual belonging to all w/in Gefüge des Sprachwesens?

HDG.WL.content: we might prepare for this change in our relation (Bezuges) to language, perhaps this experience might awaken [arrival?]

HDG.WL.linkedContent: we might prepare for this change in our relation (Bezuges) to language, perhaps this experience might awaken [arrival?]

HDG.EC.content: malice is insurgency (Aufrührerische), das im Grimmigen beruht (rests in furiousness) > essence of evil is rage (Ingrimm) of insurgency (furiousness conceals this rage, in a certain sense) > perhaps the will itself is what is evil > yes, perhaps
HDG.EC.linkedContent: malice is insurgency (Aufrührerische), das im Grimmigen beruht (rests in furiousness) > essence of evil is rage (Ingrimm) of insurgency (furiousness conceals this rage, in a certain sense) > perhaps the will itself is what is evil > yes, perhaps

HDG.EC.content: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]
